Search.description: Enter your data source name. Free text search. (case insensitive)

variables.name: future_search_jq
variables.value:
# -------- Normalization helpers --------
def fold_diacritics:
  gsub("[àáâãäå]";"a") | gsub("[ç]";"c") | gsub("[èéêë]";"e")
  | gsub("[ìíîï]";"i") | gsub("[ñ]";"n") | gsub("[òóôõö]";"o")
  | gsub("[ùúûü]";"u") | gsub("[ýÿ]";"y");

def norm:
  ascii_downcase
  | fold_diacritics
  | gsub("[^a-z0-9]+";" ")     # keep letters/numbers, turn the rest into spaces
  | gsub("\\s+";" ")           # collapse spaces
  | ltrimstr(" ")
  | rtrimstr(" ");

def tokens: norm | split(" ") | map(select(length>0));

# Unique-ifying a list
def uniq: unique;

# -------- n-gram / trigram helpers (cheap fuzzy) --------
def trigrams($s):
  ($s|length) as $n
  | if $n < 3 then [$s]
    else [ range(0; $n - 2) | $s[. : .+3] ]
    end;

def jaccard(a; b):
  (a|uniq) as $a
  | (b|uniq) as $b
  | ($a + $b) as $u
  | ($u|length) as $u_len
  | (($a + $b | group_by(.) | map(select(length>1)|.[0]) ) | length) as $i_len
  | if $u_len == 0 then 0 else ($i_len / ($u_len - $i_len)) end;

# -------- term/field scoring --------
# Boosts let you weigh certain fields more heavily
def score_record($q; $boosts):
  # Normalize query and fields
  ($q | norm) as $qnorm
  | (.title // ""     | norm) as $title
  | (.category // ""  | norm) as $category
  | (.description // "" | norm) as $desc

  # Field weights (tune as you like)
  | ($boosts.title     // 3) as $b_title
  | ($boosts.category  // 1) as $b_cat
  | ($boosts.description // 1) as $b_desc

  # Build per-field scores
  | def field_score($q; $t; $b):
      # exact/prefix/contains bonuses
      (if $t == $q then 1 else 0 end)                        as $exact
      | (if ($t|startswith($q)) and ($q|length>0) then 1 else 0 end) as $prefix
      | (if ($t|contains($q)) and ($q|length>0) then 1 else 0 end)   as $substr
      # n-gram similarity
      | (jaccard(trigrams($q); trigrams($t)))                as $jac
      # token overlap (encourages partial word matches)
      | ($q|tokens) as $qtoks
      | ($t|tokens) as $ttoks
      | (jaccard($qtoks; $ttoks)) as $tokjac
      # Weighted sum; tune numbers to taste
      | (($exact*10) + ($prefix*5) + ($substr*2) + ($jac*3) + ($tokjac*4)) * $b
    ;

  # Combine fields
  ( field_score($qnorm; $title; $b_title)
  + field_score($qnorm; $category; $b_cat)
  + field_score($qnorm; $desc; $b_desc)
  ) as $base

  # Optional: short alias corrections for common misspellings
  # Map a few likely typos to their canonical form for a small extra bump.
  | ( { "gooogle": "google", "goolge": "google", "goggl": "google" } ) as $alias
  | ($alias[$qnorm] // "") as $canonical
  | (if $canonical != "" and ($title|contains($canonical) or $desc|contains($canonical) or $category|contains($canonical))
     then 3 else 0 end) as $alias_bump

  | $base + $alias_bump
;

# -------- Main entry: pass in a query; get back sorted results --------
# Usage: jq -f search.jq --arg q "gooogle" data.json
def search($q):
  .items
  | map( . as $rec
         | ($rec | score_record($q; {title:3, description:1, category:1})) as $score
         | $rec + {score: $score}
       )
  | sort_by(-.score)
  | map(select(.score > 0));  # drop total non-matches

# Output format: id/title/score — customize as you like
def pretty:
  map({id, title, category, score: (.score|round*1.0)});

# Entry point when run with --arg q
search($q) | pretty

variables.name: row_jq
variables.value:
# --- helpers --- def esc($x): ($x|tostring|gsub("&";"&")|gsub("<";"<")|gsub(">";">")); def tag($k; $v): "" + esc($k) + ": " + esc($v) + ""; def pick_link: (.html_url // .url // .path // ""); def detect_source: (.source // ( ( .path? // "" ) as $p | if ($p | test("/community/")) then "Community" else "Official" end )); def item_row($source): . as $it | ($it.name // "Unknown") as $name | ($it.metadata_details.description // "—") as $desc | ($it.version // "N/A") as $ver | ($it.last_update // "N/A") as $lu | (pick_link) as $href | "
" + "

" + esc($name) + "

" + "

" + esc($desc) + "

" + "
" + tag("Source"; $source) + tag("Version"; $ver) + tag("Last Update"; $lu) + "
" + "
" + (if ($href|length) > 0 then "Open" else "" end) + "
" + "
"; def rows_or_empty_auto($arr; $empty_msg): ($arr // []) as $a | if ($a|length) > 0 then $a | map(item_row(detect_source)) | join("") else "
" + esc($empty_msg) + "
" end; # --- normalize input: object/array and optional .payload --- ( if type == "array" then {communityParsers_matches: .} elif has("payload") then .payload else . end ) as $root # --- collect buckets with tolerant key names --- | $root as $r | ( (($r.communityParsers_matches // []) + ($r.sentineloneParsers_matches // []) + ($r.officialParsers_matches // []) + ($r.parsers_matches // [])) ) as $parsers_all | ( (($r.dashboard_matches // []) + ($r.dashboards_matches // [])) ) as $dash_all | ( (($r.communityDetections_matches // []) + ($r.officialDetections_matches // []) + ($r.detections_matches // [])) ) as $det_all # --- output ONLY the row strings --- | { parser_rows: rows_or_empty_auto($parsers_all; "No parsers found for this data source."), dashboard_rows: rows_or_empty_auto($dash_all; "No dashboards found for this data source."), detection_rows: rows_or_empty_auto($det_all; "No detections found for this data source.") }
